subject: Ethics
title: Does Fair Trade Actually Work
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Does Fair Trade Actually Work.

hook.text: You pay $2 extra for fair-trade coffee. The farmer gets 5 cents more. Where did the rest go?

buildup.text: Fair trade guarantees minimum prices and better conditions for producers in developing countries.

discovery.text: Studies confirm fair-trade farmers earn more and invest in schools and clinics. The model worksâ€”at small scale.

twist.text: But fair trade captures under 1% of global trade. Most premium goes to middlemen and retailers, not farmers.

climax.text: Critics call it a feel-good niche. Defenders say even partial justice beats the alternative of none.

punchline.text: Fair trade helps some. Fixing trade helps all. We chose the easy one.

quiz.question: What is a key limitation of the fair trade model?
options: It makes products cheaper for consumers
It captures less than 1% of global trade and most premiums go to middlemen
Farmers refuse to participate in fair trade programs
